# Introduction
The "MC" package is to implement various Monte Carlo methods, with a focus on integration and sampling problems. All functions are implemented on Rcpp/RcppArmadillo for optimal performance.

This package is particularly useful for:

- Bayesian inference with intractable integrals
- High-dimensional integration problems
- Comparing different Monte Carlo strategies
- Educational purposes in statistical computing courses


```{r setup}
# Load the library
library(MC)
```

- Importance sampling
- Rejection sampling
- Sampling importance Resampling 
- Riemann sum strategy

```{r}
# Load necessary libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(patchwork)
library(tidyr)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)

set.seed(26)
n_reps <- 100
n_samples <- 1000

results <- comparison(n_reps, n_samples)

# Create a data framework
results_df <- data.frame(
  Method = rep(c("Importance Sampling", "Rejection Sampling", 
                 "SIR", "Riemann Strategy"), each = n_reps),
  Estimate = c(results$estimate[,1], results$estimate[,2],
               results$estimate[,3], results$estimate[,4])
)

# Summary performance
performance_stats <- data.frame(
  Method = c("Importance Sampling", "Rejection Sampling", "SIR", "Riemann Strategy"),
  Mean_Estimate = results$mean_estimates,
  Variance = results$variance_estimates,
  MSE = (results$mean_estimates - mean(results_df$Estimate))^2 + results$variance_estimates,
  Time_per_Rep = results$mean_times
)

print(performance_stats)
```
